subject: Test isolation and class-level data
msgSnippet: ... If the variable is read-only, then it is pretty well isolated, but not as well as I generally like. If one test writes to it and another test reads from
messageBody:
azuroff wrote:

> That brings up an interesting question - can test methods in classes
> that contain static variables really be considered isolated, since one
> test can accidentally change the static value needed by another test?
> And if you're going to reinitialize the static variable in the
> setUp() method every time, then what's the point in the variable being
> static?

If the variable is read-only, then it is pretty well isolated, but not
as well as I generally like.

If one test writes to it and another test reads from it, there is
usually trouble.
